text: A colt is a young male horse, under the age of four. Older male horses are called either a "stallion", if left fertile, or a "gelding" if neutered. The verb "to geld" refers to the process of neutering a stallion. A young female horse is called a filly until age four, and a mare thereafter. A group of colts is called a "rag". == References == == Other websites == * Category:Horses
title: Colt (horse)
